summary: The document is a military record detailing a 1972 incident in Germany where an unidentified individual, known as 'John Dee Jay', attempted to solicit official information from U.S. Army personnel. The individual expressed protest sentiments and had connections to the German Democratic Republic (GDR). The investigation included interviews with the approached personnel and efforts to identify 'John Dee Jay' through German channels. Originally classified, the document was regraded to unclassified in 1994.
key_findings: Incident involves an attempt to obtain official information by an unidentified individual in Germany, 1972.
Suspect known as 'John Dee Jay' had expressed anti-FRG sentiments and claimed connections to the GDR.
Document includes descriptions of the suspect and lists individuals approached by him.
Investigation involved interviews by the Dusseldorf Field Office and efforts to identify 'John Dee Jay' through German channels.
Document was originally classified but was regraded to unclassified in 1994.
